alert.note: Alert for Camp; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:19PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Morris, Titus, north central Camp and south central Red River Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 219 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Pleasant, moving northeast at 35 mph. Other strong storms extended from 20 miles south of Annona, to just southeast of Talco, with a slow southeast movement noted. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Wilkerson, Cookville, Winfield, Talco, Miller`s Cove, Rocky Mound, Harts Bluff, Monticello, Roeder and Harvard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
